name: find-outliers
description: Find outliers for a metric, or the numeric column of a query- or report result. Use this if the user explicitly asks for outliers, unusual mins/maxes, whether values are within an normal range or records that stands out in results.

anyOf.description: Get outliers for a query result column.

query_id.description: The ID of the query to analyze.

result_field_id.description: `field_id` of the column in the query result to calculate outliers on provided via `result_columns`.

anyOf.description: Get outliers for a report result column.

report_id.description: The ID of the report to analyze.

result_field_id.description: `field_id` of the column in the query result to calculate outliers on provided via `result_columns`.

metric_id.description: The ID of the report to analyze.

examples:
User: Can you find outliers? (user is looking at a query result with id 'awergasdvoihw2' with 3 numeric columns (field_ids 'aggregation_0', 'aggregation_3', 'aggregation_4' and other columns)
Assistant: {"tool_name": "find-outliers", "arguments": {"data_source": {"query_id": "awergasdvoihw2", "result_field_id": "aggregation_0"}}}, {"tool_name": "find-outliers", "arguments": {"data_source": {"query_id": "awergasdvoihw2", "result_field_id": "aggregation_3"}}}, {"tool_name": "find-outliers", "arguments": {"data_source": {"query_id": "awergasdvoihw2", "result_field_id": "aggregation_4"}}}

User: Any unusual values in the monthly page views? (user is looking at a report with id 'card__6231', page view count field_id='aggregation_0')
Assistant: {"tool_name": "find-outliers", "arguments": {"data_source": {"report_id": 6231, "result_field_id": "aggregation_0"}}}

User: Is the revenue of the last months within normal range? (user is looking at a metric with id 522)
Assistant: {"tool_name": "find-outliers", "arguments": {"data_source": {"metric_id": 522}}}
